title.label: Lots of flaws cloud a good game

content.label:
Just gonna hop straight into this one. I desperately wish I could adjust the size of the buttons. Namely, the pad is waaaay too big and it’s obnoxious to try to hit the edges of that pad to pull off moves. Absolutely hate it. It basically ruins the game. Also there are points you can buy in game, except when you select yes when asked to purchase them the game thinks you pressed no, meaning no dlc characters. Hope you don’t like the 2 fan favourite characters that literally everyone loves to play. Let me adjust button size and make the dlc purchase-able. Maybe then this game could be truly good.

EDIT: ok so just looking at the App Store you can only buy the dlc on the paid version, which is never communicated. I probably should have read up on that one. However, the dlc isn’t free with the paid version. You still have to pay for it. In addition to the $3 for the base game. Worse, the app support page is just an ad for the game. THERE IS NO ONE TO CONTACT FOR SUPPORT. Jesus Christ. Idk how snk thinks this is ok. If you want The King of Fighters on mobile just download an emulator. It’s free, gets updates and there are quality games. Honestly snk if you put time into this maybe people would get your official stuff instead of resorting to illegally pirating games. Jesus Christ no wonder you nearly went bankrupt
Great, works with no internet connection. I just wish you guys brought back the free points option so we can unlock classic iori
The best game I have ever played

If you want a great free fighting game look no further. This is exactly what I needed on my iPad. Incredible animation, wasn’t sure how fighting gameplay would work on iPad but SNK figured it out perfectly. Very addictive challenging game with so many features to unlock. The characters are so cool as always, Duolon is my favorite new characters. It doesn’t get much better than this! Must have!

Even though I just played this game a few days ago and just learned about king of fighters, (I have one of the old king of fighters games on my Nintendo) I have instantly fallen in love with the series! Especially this game! It’s free now and it’s got some cool gameplay and a good roster of characters from previous games! Though I did wish there was a mode where you could pick who you want to fight. Overall it’s a good game!

Honestly I DLed this for nostalgia and I’ve missed playing KoF....more so ‘02 UM and XI. 

This is a nod to the classic KoF in terms of gameplay but a much more better than the “previous” one after XI. Everything (chars) is carefully reworked around the move set and the hand drawn style similar to BB is an added bonus.

 4/5

Not only is the user interface crisp and beautiful, but the action is smooth and lively! Unlike Street Fighter, it has that what-you-see-is-what-you-get feel.  i.e. You don't have to study every character to know where the impact is really going to be! (SNK is good for that!)  Bluetooth AND wi-fi competition!  Also unlike SF, it's good to have a character respond to my every input without hesitation!! Glad SNK actually knows what dashing is, too –close the gap! Only things i would add is MUSIC VOLUME itself, and a d-pad input display during training for players to assess the temperament/timing of the combos. Thanks SNK! I got no problem now handing you $3 for Samurai Showdown 2, since you gifted this old school masterpiece to us –eventho i'd rather SamSho 3.
ITS TRASH TEKKEN AND MK IS SO MUCH BETTER
It’s basically a King of Fighters 13 port but with a 4:3 aspect ratio. Its really cool but the sprites are more pixely unlike the PS3 game which has hand-drawn models.
